alert.note: Alert for Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 16 at 2:51PM EST until December 19 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations around 6 to as much as 12 inches possible. The highest accumulations will be along/west of the Allegheny Front for elevations above 2,500 feet. West to northwest wind gusts around 40 to 50 mph are possible as well. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In Virginia, Western Highland County. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning. The heaviest snow is most likely late Monday afternoon through Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commute and the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of snow and blowing snow will cause visibility to be reduced to below one-half mile at times with near blizzard conditions possible.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
